text:
<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/e2edc2ed4a9a229870b1e1811b0ecf045b84e429|patch 8.2.2366: when using ":sleep" the cursor is always displayed>
patch 8.2.2366: when using ":sleep" the cursor is always displayed

Problem:    When using ":sleep" the cursor is always displayed.
Solution:   Do not display the cursor when using ":sleep!". (Jeremy Lerner,
            closes #7688)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2366: when using ":sleep" the cursor is always displayed · vim/vim@e2edc2e
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2366: when using ":sleep" the cursor is always displayed · vim/vim@e2edc2e
attachments.text: Problem: When using ":sleep" the cursor is always displayed. Solution: Do not display the cursor when using ":sleep!". (Jeremy Lerner, closes #7688)

patch 8.2.2365: Vim9: no check for map() changing item type at script level

Problem:    Vim9: no check for map() changing item type at script level.
Solution:   Check the new value type.

<https://github.com/vim/vim/commit/f898f7c68dc06def1a5ae02ce82a52a82af37cc4|patch 8.2.2364: Vim9: line break in lambda accesses freed memory>
patch 8.2.2364: Vim9: line break in lambda accesses freed memory

Problem:    Vim9: line break in lambda accesses freed memory.
Solution:   Make a copy of the return type. (closes #7664)

attachments.fallback: GitHub: patch 8.2.2364: Vim9: line break in lambda accesses freed memory · vim/vim@f898f7c
attachments.title: patch 8.2.2364: Vim9: line break in lambda accesses freed memory · vim/vim@f898f7c
attachments.text: Problem: Vim9: line break in lambda accesses freed memory. Solution: Make a copy of the return type. (closes #7664)

patch 8.2.2363: curpos() does not accept a string argument as before

solution:   Make a string argument work again. (Yegappan Lakshmanan,
            closes #7690

patch 8.2.2362: Vim9: check of builtin function argument type is incomplete

Problem:    Vim9: check of builtin function argument type is incomplete.
Solution:   Use need_type() instead of check_arg_type().

attachments.title: patch 8.2.2362: Vim9: check of builtin function argument type is inco… · vim/vim@351ead0
attachments.text: …mplete Problem: Vim9: check of builtin function argument type is incomplete. Solution: Use need_type() instead of check_arg_type().
